business.headline: Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price tumbled nearly 6%VI shares were down 5.09% to Rs 8.22 at around 3:15 pm. Earlier during the trading session, shares of the telecom operator fell as much as 6%.

Ambani family richest in Asia. Check which Indian families made the top 20The Ambani family tops Bloomberg's list of Asia's 20 richest families. The family's flagship company, Reliance Industries, is presently headed by Mukesh Ambani, son of late industrialist Dhirubhai Ambani.

RBI curbs on New India Co-operative Bank: How does it impact customers?New India Co-operative Bank has been struggling with financial losses in recent years. According to its annual report, the bank recorded a loss of Rs 22.78 crore in the financial year ending March 2024, following a loss of Rs 30.75 crore in the previous year.

New India Co-operative Bank's financial operations halted after notice from RBIThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has restricted Mumbai-based New India Co-operative Bank from issuing loans, accepting deposits, or permitting withdrawals for six months. The move comes amid concerns over the bank's financial health and liquidity.

Not Trump's tariffs, but this is what's making stock market investors anxiousThe stock market jitters have occurred despite government measures, including tax relief and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision to reduce the repo rate by 25 basis points.

RBI issues notice to halt all financial operations of New India Co-operative BankRBI's move comes after what it called 'recent material developments' at the bank. Although the central bank did not provide specific details, it stated that these directions were issued to protect depositors' interests.

New income tax bill: All you questions answeredThe new income tax bill, compared to the Income Tax Act, 1961, is nearly half the size, containing 259,676 words, 23 chapters, 536 sections, 57 tables and 46 formulae.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: Why is the stock market down today?The Sensex and Nifty fell sharply after rising in early trade. Here are three things you need to know about today's stock market weakness.

New Income Tax bill explained: What's changing and what's notNew Income Tax bill: It aims to simplify the existing Income Tax Act, 1961, by making it more structured and easier to understand. If passed, the new law will come into effect from April 1, 2026.

EPFO likely to maintain 8.25% interest rate on PF deposits EPFO interest rate: In 2024-25, EPFO processed over 50.8 million claims worth Rs 2.05 lakh crore when compared to 44.5 million claims amounting to Rs 1.82 lakh crore settled in the previous year, as per the official data.

entertainment.headline: Dhoom Dhaam review: Romance meets thrill in this Yami Gautam-Pratik Gandhi filmReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Dhoom Dhaam movie review: Dhoom Dhaam blends romance with action and comedy, offering a refreshing alternative to traditional Valentine's Day films. These characters, crafted by female screenwriters, challenge traditional portrayals. This Valentine's Day we analyse if they are too good to be true.

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs. makes questions on marital rape, mechanical sex personalImagine a woman bleeding for five days in a month, and those five days being the most peaceful in her life because she can finally refuse sex to her husband. general news.headline: F-35 jets, Stryker vehicles, engine deal: Defence ties take off at PM-Trump meetThe meeting between PM Modi and US President Donald Trump saw the two sides agreeing to ramp up defence ties for more efficient arms transfer and procurement, and laying the framework for a stronger, technology-driven partnership.

Who all might lose sleep after Tahawwur Rana's extraditionUS President Donald Trump confirmed the immediate extradition of the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks accused Tahawwur Rana to India and said more would follow. The question is who is next in line. Before PM Modi's US visit, India handed over a list of 10 fugitives, including gangsters Goldy Brar and Anmol Bishnoi, to Washington DC.

When Nasa spacecraft miraculously landed on an asteroid without any plan Twenty-four years ago, a spacecraft with no landing mechanism touched down on a chunk of rock in space. Defying all odds, the Nasa spacecraft became the first in history to not just orbit a minor planet, but touch it. It miraculously survived for two weeks and transmitted crucial data back to the Earth.

sports.headline: Pakistan star Babar Azam faster than Virat Kohli to complete 6000 runs in ODIsFormer Pakistan captain Babar Azam completed 6,000 runs in his 123rd innings, which came in the ODI tri-series final against New Zealand in Karachi on Friday, February 14. The Aussies will look for inspiration from Steve Smith and a bit of magic from their remaining ODI World Cup heroes to win the Champions Trophy for the first time since 2009.

Kohli gifts signed India jersey to Pietersen's son: Fits like a gloveVirat Kohli gifted a signed India jersey to Kevin Pietersen's son, Dylan, prompting a heartfelt Instagram post from the former England captain, who expressed gratitude for the special gesture.

JP Duminy backs Rohit Sharma to put up big performances in Champions TrophyFormer South Africa cricketer JP Duminy has backed India captain Rohit Sharma to put up big performances in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Rohit recently bounced back to form in the 2nd ODI vs England.

Pakistan captain backs star batter with interesting takeODI tri-series final: Speaking on the eve of the final, Pakistan captain Mohammad Rizwan defended Babar Azam, saying the star batter is facing additional pressure because of 'extreme expectations'. Babar failed in the first two matches of the series.

McCullum hits back at 'factually incorrect' criticism over England's practiceEngland head coach Brendon McCullum has hit back at the criticism over England holding fewer practice sessions during their recent white-ball series against India.

Champions Trophy: Shreyas Iyer's admission reveals India's think-tank problemWhy fix something that isn't broken? India seem to be overcomplicating their combination in the ODI series against England, which is a worrying sign ahead of the Champions Trophy. There appears to be a real problem of plenty for coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Rohit Sharma. Why on earth did they leave out Shreyas Iyer for the series opener in Nagpur? An injury to Virat Kohli meant Shreyas got an opportunity after a late phone call from the skipper. The star batter revealed he was not in the XI as late as the eve of the match.

After Champions Trophy snub, Yashasvi Jaiswal to play Ranji Trophy semifinalAfter missing out on a place in India's final 15-man squad for the Champions Trophy, Yashasvi Jaiswal was drafted into Mumbai's Ranji Trophy squad for their semi-final against Vidarbha in Nagpur.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna.
